definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: One reason-how ice jams can affect areas near river.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個原因是冰塞影響到了附近地區的河流。

sentences.english: In the Kankakee River in Illinois, ice jam stretch for miles.
sentences.chinese: 在伊利諾斯州坎河的冰塞綿延數英里。

sentences.english: Firstly, the main factors influence the form and development of the ice jam is analyzed in detail in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文首先分析冰塞形成和發展的主要因素。

definition: freezing blockage/dam of ice on river
ice-jam flood (arising when river downstream freezes more than upstream)
to flow backwards (of water, because of flood, tide, wind etc)/reverse flow/to back up (sewage)
to freeze over (of water or land)
